steps.expectation: Verify AttestationResponse is received

Extract the attestation_elements_message structure fields from the AttestationResponse
Verify AttestationElements field size
steps.expectation: AttestationElements field size should not be greater than RESP_MAX(900 bytes)

steps.description: Verify certification_declaration format
steps.expectation: certification_declaration is present and is an octet string representation CMS-format certification declaration, as described in section 6.3.1

steps.description: Verify CD format_version
steps.expectation: format_version = 1

steps.description: Verify CD vendor_id
steps.expectation: vendor_id field matches `basic_info_vendor_id` and is in the standard vendor ID range

steps.description: Verify CD product_id_array
steps.expectation: product_id_array field contains `basic_info_product_id`

steps.description: Verify CD device_type_id
steps.expectation: device_type_id has a value between 0 and (2^31 - 1)

steps.description: Verify CD certificate_id
steps.expectation: certificate_id has a length of 19

steps.description: Verify CD security level
steps.expectation: security level = 0

steps.description: Verify CD security_information
steps.expectation: security_information = 0

steps.description: Verify CD version_number
steps.expectation: version_number is an integer in range 0..65535

steps.description: Verify CD certification_type
steps.expectation: certification_type has a value between 1..2

steps.description: Extract the Vendor ID (VID) and Product ID (PID) from the DAC. Extract the VID from the PAI. Extract the PID from the PAI, if present
steps.expectation: VID and PID are present and properly encoded in the DAC. VID is present and properly encoded in the PAI. If the PID is present in the PAI, it is properly encoded

If the dac_origin_vendor_id is present in the CD, confirm the dac_origin_product_id is also present. If the dac_origin_vendor_id is not present in the CD, confirm the dac_origin_product_id is also not present.

steps.description: If the Certification Declaration has both the dac_origin_vendor_id and the dac_origin_product_id fields, verify dac_origin fields
steps.expectation:
* The Vendor ID (VID) in the DAC subject and PAI subject are the same as the dac_origin_vendor_id field in the Certification Declaration.
* The Product ID (PID) in the DAC subject is same as the dac_origin_product_id field in the Certification Declaration.
* If it is present in the PAI certificate, the Product ID (PID) in the subject is same as the dac_origin_product_id field in the Certification Declaration.

steps.description: If the Certification Declaration has neither the dac_origin_vendor_id nor the dac_origin_product_id fields, verify the vendor_id and product_id_array fields
steps.expectation:
* The Vendor ID (VID) in the DAC subject and PAI subject are the same as the vendor_id field in the Certification Declaration.
* The Product ID (PID) subject DN in the DAC is contained in the product_id_array field in the Certification Declaration.
* If it is present in the PAI certificate, the Product ID (PID) in the subject is contained in the product_id_array field in the Certification Declaration.

steps.description: If the Certification Declaration has authorized_paa_list, check that the authority_key_id extension of the PAI matches one found in the authorized_paa_list
steps.expectation: PAA from PAI authority_key_id extension matches one found in authorized_paa_list

steps.description: Verify that the certification_declaration CMS enveloped can be verified with the well-known Certification Declaration public key used to originally sign the Certification Declaration
steps.expectation: Signature verification passes

steps.description: Verify attestation_nonce
steps.expectation:
* attestation_nonce is present in the attestation_elements_message structure
* attestation_nonce value matches the AttestationNonce field value sent in the AttestationRequest Command sent by the commissioner
* attestation_nonce is a 32 byte-long octet string

steps.description: If firmware_information is present, verify firmware information type
steps.expectation: firmware_information is an octet string

steps.description: Using Crypto_Verify cryptographic primitive, validate that the AttestationSignature from the AttestationResponse Command is valid if verified against a message constructed by concatenating AttestationElements with the attestation challenge associated with the secure session over which the AttestationResponse was obtained, using the subject public key found in the DAC.
steps.expectation: Signature is valid

tests.desc: 3.2.4 [TC-TSTAT-4-2] Preset write and command attributes test case with server as DUT

steps.description: Commissioning, already done
TH writes to the Presets attribute without calling the AtomicRequest command
steps.expectation: Verify that the write request returns INVALID_IN_STATE error since the client didn't send a request to edit the presets by calling AtomicRequest command.

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute after calling the AtomicRequest begin command but doesn't call AtomicRequest commit
steps.expectation: Verify that the Presets attribute was not updated since AtomicRequest commit command was not called.

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute after calling the AtomicRequest begin command and calls AtomicRequest commit
steps.expectation: Verify that the Presets attribute was updated with new presets.

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a built-in preset removed
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a preset removed whose handle matches the value in the ActivePresetHandle attribute
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned INVALID_IN_STATE (0xcb).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a built-in preset modified to be not built-in
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a new preset having builtIn set to true
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a new preset having a preset handle that doesn't exist in the Presets attribute
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned NOT_FOUND (0x8b).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with duplicate presets
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a non built-in preset modified to be built-in
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a preset that doesn't support names in the PresetTypeFeatures bitmap but has a name
steps.expectation: Verify that the AtomicRequest commit returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute but calls the AtomicRequest rollback command to cancel the edit request
steps.expectation: Verify that the edit request was rolled back

steps.description: TH starts an atomic write, and TH2 attempts to open an atomic write before TH is complete
steps.expectation: Verify that the atomic request is rejected

steps.description: TH starts an atomic write, and TH2 attempts to write to presets
steps.expectation: Verify that the write request is rejected

steps.description: TH starts an atomic write, and before it's complete, TH2 removes TH's fabric; TH2 then opens an atomic write
steps.expectation: Verify that the atomic request is successful

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute with a preset that has a presetScenario not present in PresetTypes attribute
steps.expectation: Verify that the write request returned CONSTRAINT_ERROR (0x87).

steps.description: TH writes to the Presets attribute such that the total number of presets is greater than the number of presets supported
steps.expectation: Verify that the write request returned RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED (0x89).
